### PR summary [078b7b8ef6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14377/commits/078b7b8ef62de8534fa35e32a1736e720f48353e)

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.SurjectiveOnStalks`|1185|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.PrimeSpectrum.TensorProduct`|1292|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsBasis.le_iff`
`+ PrimeSpectrum.continuous_tensorProductTo`
`+ PrimeSpectrum.embedding_tensorProductTo_of_surjectiveOnStalks`

`+ PrimeSpectrum.tensorProductTo`
`+ SurjectiveOnStalks`
`+ SurjectiveOnStalks.baseChange`

`+ surjectiveOnStalks_iff_forall_maximal'`

`+ surjectiveOnStalks_of_exists_div`
`+ surjectiveOnStalks_of_isLocalization`
`+ surjectiveOnStalks_of_surjective`
`+ surjective_localRingHom_iff`

</details>

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the reviews!
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10109718027/job/27958202459)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10109718027/job/27958203116)

Thanks!

bors d+
LGTM
Looks good, added some comments.
LGTM

Thanks!

bors d+

```suggestion
  then `Spec(S ⊗[R] T) → Spec S × Spec T` is a topological embedding.
```
Wait, don't we already have the statement that this is an iso? Or is it only an iso as raw types?
No the RHS is the cartesian product equipped with the product topology. I changed the wording a bit.

Here, using the namespace `SurjectiveOnStalks` might be useful for dot notation. For `of_surjective` and `of_isLocalization`, dot notation is useless, so I'm not sure we want them in the namespace. In any case you might want to just open the namespace at some point to avoid writing `SurjectiveOnStalks.` all the time.
I adjusted the names according to your suggestions. I refrained from using `namespace` as only a few lemmas are in it.
Maybe this lemma deserves a docstring to explain its usage, since it's used a lot.
Add some more details about what results are in this file?

```suggestion
    exact ⟨_, _, _, c.2, t.2, hc.symm⟩
  · refine fun H y ↦ Localization.ind (fun ⟨y, t, h⟩ ↦ ?_) y
```

```suggestion
  intro J hJ
  rw [surjective_localRingHom_iff]
  intro x
  obtain ⟨t, r, a, ht, e⟩ := exists_mul_eq_tmul_of_surjectiveOnStalks hf x (J.comap g)
    inferInstance
  exact ⟨a, algebraMap _ _ r, 1 ⊗ₜ (r • t), ht, ?_, ?_⟩ 
```
I don't think `exact` works here.
You're right, I misread
Could you add a reference to the file where "surjective on stalks" is defined?
Maybe this should just be term of type `C(_, _)`?
I think I prefer unbundled morphisms more. Plus the main point of this function is that it is a topological embedding (under assumptions) and not merely continuous functions.
Could this part be extracted to a lemma about when a topology `t` satisfies `t \le zariskiTopology`?
Is the newly added `IsBasis.le_iff` what you are thinking of?
Yes, thanks

The docstring doesn't make sense.
`(1 ⊗ r • t) * x = a ⊗ t` for some `a : S`, `r : R` and `t: T` such that `r • t ∉ J`
I had been told that one should now prefer `induction` to `induction'`.
This is not crucial, but below you denote prime ideals as `P`, maybe that would be clearer here.
What in the syntax makes us sure that it is a basis for `t₂`? Wouldn't it be safer to enter `@IsBasis α t₂ Us`?
`SurjectiveOnStalks` uses `(I : Ideal _) (_ : IsPrime I)`, but here you use `p : PrimeSpectrum _`. In what case do you prefer which?
I only use `PrimeSpectrum` when I need the zarkisi topology.
Is it needed here?
Oh, I see. The `_aux` function proves half of injectivity, but  embedding is both injectivity and something about the topology.
(By the way, maybe a leaner syntax such as`IsBasis[t₂] Us` was preferable, I don't know the usages here.)
I just looked for it as well but seems like it does not exist. This is the only occurrence of `@IsBasis` in mathlib so maybe it's not worth adding it.
Maybe that exists for `Opens`, anyway, there's no ambiguity here which is what matters.
Besides composition, is it relevant to add the case of `id` or would the case of localization take care of it?
`surjectiveOnStalks_of_surjective` should cover it quite easily.

```suggestion
variable (R S T : Type*) [CommRing R] [CommRing S] [Algebra R S]
```
Is this the same?
What does the `$` do? (personal curiosity).

It is the syntax of `congr`. If `e` is a term of type `a = b`, `congr(f $e)` is a term of type `f a = f b`. Here it is `congr(($h).2.1)` Apparently lean is smart enough to figure out the dot notations.
Is the `@` needed here?
Yes because the `TopologicalSpace` argument is not the one given by typeclass synthesis.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory): Surjective on stalks ring homomorphisms.
